metadata.title: CVE-2024-26622 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tomoyo:fix UAF write bug in tomoyo_write_control() Since tomoyo_write_control()updates head->write_buf when write() of long lines is requested, we need tofetch head->write_buf after head->io_sem is held. Otherwise, concurrentwrite() requests can cause use-after-free-write and double-free problems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-107-generic - 5.15.0-107.117
linux-image-5.15.0-107-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-107.117
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-107-generic - 5.15.0-107.117
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-107-generic-64k - 5.15.0-107.117
No subscription required
